reviews.review: faktu super hra asi si koupim  Portal 2

Combining logic puzzles, comedy and the Half-Life universe, Portal is a finely crafted, memorable experience that is just long enough to leave the player hungry for more.

Players are thrown into the heel springs of Chell, a slient test subject of the Aperture Science Enrichment Centre. Guided by the omipresent voice of GLaDOS, the player must navigate 19 different test chambers outfitted with different challenges. New gameplay mechanics are introduced gently, allowing time for the player to become acclimated to the different way of thinking in this first-person game. The pace is slow, leading to greater feelings of accomplishment when the player completes a test.

Using the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device, players can create portals on flat surfaces and travel between them. Stepping through the orange portal will cause the player to emerge from the blue portal and vice versa. The puzzles centred around this mechanic display a great level of creativity and enginuity, making each test challenging but not impossibly difficult.

As the players progress through the Enrichment Centre, they interact with the computerised voice of GLaDOS who is arguably the reason most people will remember Portal. The dialogue is sharply written and, at times, laugh out loud funny. The delivery of Ellen McLain is faultless and is the icing on an already delicious cake.

Portal is short, but is just long enough to leave the players wanting more without making them feel unsatisfied. While multiple playthroughs will be trivially easy due to the player's familiarity with the puzzles, it is still an entertaining experience down to GLaDOS.

OBRA MAESTRA.

Juego de puzzles en primera persona, diferente a lo visto hasta ahora. Se hace un poco corto el modo 'historia' 19 niveles (donde 8 o 9 de ellos son casi un ''tutorial''). Aunque para conseguir ciertos logros tienes que pasartelo un par de veces. Historia entretenida y divertida :)

También tiene niveles Bonus que ponen un toque de dificultad al juego.

This is definately one of the best games I've ever played.

Relatively short game, but a fantastic one at that. 

It's well-executed and unique gameplay set it apart from most games with an amusing, tongue-in-cheek script. 

The portal gun is magic, I wouldn’t mind having one of those in real life, and really requires you to think of different ways to solve the test chambers.

End credits was a joy to watch.

Highly recommended!

Portal is an incredible, but small game that can really provoke philosophical thought and conversation out of a player like myself. The graphics are not "of the walls" amazing, but very good for its time. The sound is effective, but not a soundtrack I would listen to casually. The story is bare, but what exists is tasteful and clear-cut. It helps that the subsequent comic and sequel help flesh-out the story more. The game play is ingeniously addicting, which is why it is a good thing this game is so short. I give this game a solid 9/10.

A game that became an instant classic among gamers, Fun Gameplay, Enriching Story with great witty comedy. Although The game is very short ~2-3 hours it's definitely a MUST PLAY and if you want to get a friend into gaming, get them to play this!

I do love the narrative but the puzzles are a bit much for me. Puzzle games are not really my thing. I don't have nearly enough patience for them. I'm more of a let's-just-press-random-buttons-and-hope-it-works sort of player. I don't sit down and quietly think it through. If you like puzzles, Portal is a fantastic game with a great story. A good number of my friends have played and finished it. I haven't.

An absolutely incredible game.  Part of the fun isn't just solving the puzzles, but figuring out how the puzzles actually work.  It's very intuitive, and I would even say that some of the solutions feel beautiful.

My only complaint is the shortness of the game.  However, the challenge modes for the last six puzzles add elements that turn them into entirely new puzzles, so don't forget to do those extra challenges!

This is one of the best games I've ever played, and no PC gamer's life can be complete before they have finished portal.

It's impossible to explain exactly why it's so good. You know when you play Game Dev tycoon and, even though you never expected it, it turns out all the sliders are in exactly the right place and you get a nigh-perfect score for a really low budget game? That's portal. 

This game is challenging, but not because of skill. You develop the skills required within the first few levels, so there's no problems with repeating a level over and over again, desperately trying to point accurately enough and click fast enough to win. The challenge in this game is not in the doing but in the thinking; the difficulty lies in figuring out what you need to do, and you get an immense satisfaction when you finally figure it out. 

And who could forget the humor? The great thing about the humor of this game is that it's witty rather than silly, and the game's not contantly jumping up and down yelling "hey, look at me! I'm FUNNY!" The humor is used sparingly, and is therefore much funnier. 

PLEASE, play this game. I know it looks pretty average on paper, but I must now join all its other players in telling you that you just have to TRUST US. 

If for nothing else, play this game so that you can finally know why everyone's getting so worked up over cake, and so you can finally understand what the words of Still Alive mean! 

My one tip: When you're stuck, get a different perspective. Place a portal near the roof and look through it, or fling yourself into the air--quite often all you need to do is see things from a different angle!

"Come back to the recovery annex,for your cake"-GLaDOS
After beating Portal 2(which is also an amazing game btw :) ),I got this game during the summer sale,and recently tried the game out,and I agree with other people who have played this game on the fact that it is an amazing game,despite it's short length
The plot(in a basic summary,I'm not entirely sure of plot details myself): You play as a woman named Chell who,under the"supervision"(sort of xD)of the AI GLaDOS,go through 19 test chambers,using a portal gun that creates orange and blue portals,which really play a key role in solving puzzles in the test chambers. Eventually you turn against GLaDOS,discovering GLaDOS's true plans,and destroy her once and for all(except until Portal 2 of course)

The music is very good,in fact,in the relaxation vault at the beginning of the game,there's a nice little catchy song that plays on a radio :) 

While there are kinda few characters in this game(really there's only GLaDOS,Chell,and the turrets,and that's it)they still are very likable characters,especially GLaDOS with her hilarious dialogue(R.I.P. youtube comments section with their"THE CAKE IS A LIE"spam XD)

The puzzles aren't as complex I would say as Portal 2's puzzles are,but they still are kinda challenging,in fact some involve timing putting your Portals on portal-able surfaces right

Overall,while this game is pretty short(It should take you about 2-4 hours your first time),the hilarious dialogue,nice learning curve on the puzzles for those new to Portal,and great characters make up for that

10/10 from me :)

Josefa Rodriguez, una joven niña de 10años, se ha puesto a ver los dibujos animados como es normal. Como cualquier niño, ha decidido imitar a los dibujos y se ha puesto a abrir agujeros en la pared con el taladro de su padre, mientras la acompaña el amigo fiel de Josefa, un tamagochi. Un dia, la madre de Josefa la pilla, y aparte de echarle una buena bronca, le ha dejado 1 semana sin usar el tuenti, 2 sin Instagram, no le deja salir durante un mes, y arrestada sin ver Hannah Montana y Tres metros sobre el cielo.

Прошел основной сюжет практически на одном дыхании. Вечером начал, утром закончил и получил тортик ;) 
Игра показалась мне простой в плане прохождния основной линии, даже как то не привычно, что смог пройти игру за 4 часа, это при том, что я ламер в шутерах. А вот на усложненых камерах похоже я задержусь, местами впадаю в депрессию от ощущения непроходимости)) 
Игра больше на сообразительност, но есть места где нужно умение играть в шутеры, вот тут я и проигрываю...
Мне понравилась необычность идеи с порталами, решать головоломки и при этом ощущать себя непосредственно испытуемым, необычное ощущения от игры!

отпадные и качественные игры!Хочу ещё сказать про персонажей( их гараздо мало чем во второй части)они прекрасны, осовбенно челл, а GLaDOS  просто "ангельский голос"Гейплей просто красивый, больше мне сказать нечего!
Всё всем пока, я закончил.
